description: The round payoff this round was 118. You, Kate chose to play option 1.John chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of 0.
Mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) maximizes individual and collective payoffs (59 each vs. lower alternatives).
Choosing option 1 risks a zero payoff if the other player defects, incentivizing caution or retaliation in future rounds.
Defecting (option 2) secures partial payoff (39.33) if the other cooperates but is less profitable than mutual cooperation.
The game structure resembles a coordination problem with two Nash equilibria: mutual cooperation (optimal) or mutual defection (suboptimal).
